As some who are monitoring the Sourceforge project may have noticed 
(over 200 downloads already!), Heritrix 1.12.1 was released May 6 and is 
  available for download:

http://sourceforge.net/project/showfiles.php?group_id=73833&package_id=73980&release_id=506395 


Release 1.12.1 is primarily a bug-fix release. A total of 21 bugs have 
been addressed, including an object-retention issue when running 
multiple jobs in sequence, a failure to enforce fetch timeouts on 
certain malformed server responses, and decide-rule overrides 
disappearing when basing jobs on earlier jobs/profiles. There are also 
several enhancements, such as reporting the volume of data evaluated but 
not transferred/stored when using duplicate-reduction features.

See the Release Notes for more details:

http://crawler.archive.org/articles/releasenotes/1_12_1.html

And a list of all tracked changes is available at:

http://webteam.archive.org/confluence/display/Heritrix/Issues+with+%27Fix+Version%27+1.12.1

Yours,

The Internet Archive Web Team
